decks.notes: The deck aims to control the game by using a variety of counter spells, removal, and card advantage to outvalue the opponent. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to dominate the board and generate card advantage. Additionally, it leverages efficient creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining control of the battlefield. The mana base is designed to support the control game plan with a mix of dual lands and utility lands to ensure consistency in casting spells.

The deck revolves around maximizing graveyard interactions to quickly fuel out powerful creatures like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, and Hogaak while also taking advantage of cards like Bridge from Below and Altar of Dementia to create overwhelming board presence and pressure. The goal is to aggressively combo off early in the game, overwhelming the opponent with a flood of creatures that can be constantly recurred from the graveyard. The deck aims to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield and close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana with Urza's lands and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void and All Is Dust, while also providing utility with cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Walking Ballista. Overall, the deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and controlling the board to overwhelm opponents in a fast-paced, aggressive manner.

The main concept of this Modern Dredge combo deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, Insolent Neonate, and Stitcher's Supplier to fuel powerful graveyard synergies. By using cards like Altar of Dementia and Bridge from Below, the deck aims to reanimate creatures like Vengevine and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis while overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of creatures. The deck also utilizes sacrifice outlets like Carrion Feeder and Hangarback Walker to generate value and stay ahead in the game.

The deck focuses on quickly bringing out aggressive creatures like Arclight Phoenix, Monastery Swiftspear, and Soul-Scar Mage to deal fast and consistent damage to the opponent. It also includes a number of cheap and efficient spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Forked Bolt to control the board and help trigger the Phoenix's ability. The deck is designed to be fast-paced and proactive, putting pressure on the opponent early in the game and overwhelming them with a constant stream of creatures and burn spells.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive lineup of Human creatures. By utilizing cards that pump up the strength of Humans and disrupt the opponent's gameplay, this deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and apply pressure to the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for creatures to be easily put onto the battlefield without using mana, giving the deck a tempo advantage. The mana base is designed to support the multicolor nature of the deck while maximizing consistency.

This deck utilizes the dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures. It then uses cards like Bridge from Below and Altar of Dementia to generate tokens or mill opponents. The key strategy is to combine Altar of Dementia with Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis, allowing for a quick and powerful combo. Additional support comes from cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier to facilitate card draw and further fill the graveyard. The deck also includes creatures like Vengevine and Carrion Feeder to apply pressure and maintain board presence.

This deck focuses on aggressively playing low-cost, high-impact spells and creatures, while using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Ranger-Captain of Eos for disruption and control. The key strategy is to quickly lower your own life total to power up Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler, while using disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial to control your opponent's resources. The deck also includes powerful card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy to maintain pressure on the opponent and win the game quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly flood the board with Human creatures, utilizing cards like Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Noble Hierarch to pump them up and overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage are included to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while Aether Vial helps to cheat creatures into play. The deck also includes a mix of both aggressive and disruptive cards to apply pressure and control the board, with a strong mana base to support the Human tribal theme.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively fill up the graveyard with cards like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, and Stitcher's Supplier in order to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Vengevine and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. Using cards like Altar of Dementia and Bridge from Below, the player can combo off and overwhelm their opponent with a fast and aggressive graveyard strategy, while also utilizing Carrion Feeder for additional sacrifice synergy. This deck aims to efficiently and effectively utilize the dredge mechanic to create explosive and game-winning turns.

The main concept of this UR Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while setting up your own win conditions. The deck utilizes cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Cryptic Command to control the board, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Magmatic Sinkhole. Thing in the Ice provides a win condition by transforming into a powerful threat, while Blood Moon can disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck also includes card draw and counterspells to keep the opponent from gaining an advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing Spirit creatures with a mix of disruptive spells and Aether Vial to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Spell Queller, Supreme Phantom, and Drogskol Captain, the deck aims to apply pressure early and often while protecting its own creatures. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben provides additional disruption for the opponent, while Deputy of Detention helps control the board. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while cards like Mausoleum Wanderer and Rattlechains provide additional utility and flexibility. Overall, the deck aims to apply relentless pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with creature cards, triggering powerful abilities and generating value from cards like Hogaak, Vengevine, and Bridge from Below. By utilizing cards like Faithless Looting, Insolent Neonate, and Stitcher's Supplier, you can efficiently dredge through your deck and put creatures into play for free. With the ability to recur creatures like Bloodghast and Gravecrawler, along with sacrificing them to Altar of Dementia for additional value, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless swarm of creatures while disrupting their game plan.

The main concept of this combo Dredge deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Bridge from Below and Bloodghast, allowing for powerful reanimation plays with cards like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Gravecrawler. By using cards such as Cathartic Reunion and Faithless Looting to discard cards and draw into more combo pieces, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures while also disrupting their game plan. The deck is focused on utilizing the graveyard as a resource to generate advantage and win the game through explosive combos.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures using cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier, then utilize Bridge from Below and Altar of Dementia to create a powerful combo with Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. By sacrificing creatures and milling yourself, you can bring back multiple Vengevines and Bloodghasts while generating zombies from Bridge from Below. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and resilient graveyard-based strategy, utilizing cards like Carrion Feeder to keep the pressure on.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It utilizes control elements like Oblivion Stone, Relic of Progenitus, and Karn Liberated to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to quickly close out the game once the Tron lands are assembled. Overall, the deck aims to control the game's tempo and overwhelm the opponent with its large threats.
